channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CBS Taps Conservative Policy Veteran for New Ombudsman Role
item.description: Kenneth R. Weinstein, who will review complaints about CBS News, was head of the right-leaning Hudson Institute, a think tank, and has no experience o...

item.title: The one-time ‘Oracle of Wall Street’ who called the 2008 crash sounds the alarm for Gen Z and Millennials in the year ahead
item.description: Meredith Whitney says younger generations face significant financial headwinds.

item.title: Vodafone’s new ad proves even influencers can be replaced by AI
item.description: An AI-generated spokesperson talked up a company promotion on TikTok.

item.title: Murdoch Family Puts Lachlan in Control, Resolving Succession Fight
item.description: Lachlan Murdoch will take control of a new family trust in a deal worth $3.3 billion, ensuring that his father’s media empire will retain its conserva...

item.title: The Murdoch Succession Fight Is Over. So What Does Lachlan Control?
item.description: From Fox News to Tubi to HarperCollins, here’s what is in the media empire that Rupert Murdoch built.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s planned report linking Tylenol to autism crashes shares of parent company Kenvue
item.description: RFK Jr. is preparing a report that will allegedly claim a link between prenatal Tylenol (acetaminophen) use and autism.

item.title: Trump Administration Says It Has Begun Immigration Crackdown in Chicago
item.description: In Chicago, advocates for immigrants said they saw several arrests on Sunday, but were uncertain of the scale of federal action.

item.title: Red Sea cable cuts disrupt internet in Asia, Middle East; Houthis deny involvement as Microsoft warns of disruption
item.description: Undersea cable cuts in the Red Sea disrupted internet access in parts of Asia and the Middle East, experts said Sunday, though it wasn't immediately c...

item.title: Supreme Court Lifts Restrictions on L.A. Immigration Stops
item.description: A federal judge had ordered agents not to make indiscriminate stops relying on factors like a person’s ethnicity or that they speak Spanish.

item.title: The energy department said wind and solar capacity is ‘worthless’ without sunlight or wind. Elon Musk reminds DoE about batteries: ‘Um… hello?’
item.description: Musk touted a massive energy storage project in Australia designed to stabilize the grid and expand renewable use.

item.title: Gunmen Attack Bus Stop in Jerusalem, Killing at Least 6
item.description: The Israeli police described the shooting as a terrorist attack and said that the perpetrators had been killed at the scene.

item.title: 10 Killed and 61 Injured in Mexico After Train Crashes Into Bus
item.description: Accidents involving vehicles and trains have been increasing as the Mexican government has pushed to revitalize railroads and build new passenger line...

item.title: Trump Issues Warning to Hamas as Israeli Military Moves on Gaza City
item.description: The U.S. president gave Hamas what sounded like an ultimatum to either agree to a new truce proposal or face a full-scale Israeli assault on Gaza City...

item.title: London Tube Strike Takes Effect, Causing Travel Chaos
item.description: Underground stations were closed and buses were crammed with commuters grappling with a walkout by transit workers that is expected to continue until ...

item.title: 19 Killed in Nepal ‘Gen Z’ Protests Over Social Media Ban and Corruption
item.description: The government retreated from the ban amid anger over violent dispersal of demonstrators protesting graft, inequality and social media controls.
